alert.note: Alert for Allen (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 8:05AM EST until February 19 at 10:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...Ohio... Salamonie River below Warren affecting Wabash, Huntington, Blackford, Wells and Jay Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio near St. Joe River Ft. Wayne affecting Allen IN County. Saint Joseph River Ohio near Newville affecting Allen IN, De Kalb and Defiance Counties. Saint Marys River at St. Mary`s River near Fort Wayne affecting Allen IN County. .The combination of snowmelt and up to 2 inches of rainfall will result in rapid rises on the rivers. In addition, this rise could also shift ice in the river that could lead to ice jams. This forecast is based on unobstructed flow and does not factor additional rises associated with ice jams. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saint Joseph River Ohio near St. Joe River Ft. Wayne. * WHEN...From this evening to late Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Lowland and farmland flooding near the river begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EST Thursday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 13.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
